verses.verse: Gedaliah Made Governor of Judah Then he made Gedaliah the son of (2 Kin. 22:12) Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, governor over (Is. 1:9; Jer. 40:5) the people who remained in the land of Judah, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had left.

Now when all the (Jer. 40:7-9) captains of the armies, they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah governor, they came to Gedaliah at Mizpah—Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, Johanan the son of Careah, Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite, and Jaazaniah the son of a Maachathite, they and their men.

And Gedaliah took an oath before them and their men, and said to them, “Do not be afraid of the servants of the Chaldeans. Dwell in the land and serve the king of Babylon, and it shall be well with you.”

But (Jer. 41:1-3) it happened in the seventh month that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, of the royal family, came with ten men and struck and killed Gedaliah, the Jews, as well as the Chaldeans who were with him at Mizpah.
And all the people, small and great, and the captains of the armies, arose (2 Kin. 19:31; Jer. 43:4-7) and went to Egypt; for they were afraid of the Chaldeans.

Jehoiachin Released from Prison (2 Kin. 24:12, 15; Jer. 52:31-34) Now it came to pass in the thirty-seventh year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, that Evil-Merodach king of Babylon, in the year that he began to reign, (Gen. 40:13, 20) released Jehoiachin king of Judah from prison.
He spoke kindly to him, and gave him a more prominent seat than those of the kings who were with him in Babylon.
So Jehoiachin changed from his prison garments, and he (2 Sam. 9:7) ate bread regularly before the king all the days of his life.
And as for his provisions, there was a regular ration given him by the king, a portion for each day, all the days of his life.
The Family of Adam—Seth to Abraham Adam, (Gen. 10:26) Seth, Enosh,
Cainan, Mahalalel, Jared,
Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech,
(Gen. 5:28—10:1) Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
(Gen. 10:2-4) The sons of Japheth were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
The sons of Gomer were Ashkenaz, Diphath, and Togarmah.
The sons of Javan were Elishah, Tarshishah, Kittim, and Rodanim.
(Gen. 10:6) The sons of Ham were Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
The sons of Cush were Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raama, and Sabtecha. The sons of Raama were Sheba and Dedan.
Cush (Gen. 10:8-10, 13) begot Nimrod; he began to be a mighty one on the earth.
Mizraim begot Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim,
Pathrusim, Casluhim (from whom came the Philistines and the (Deut. 2:23) Caphtorim).
(Gen. 9:18, 25-27; 10:15) Canaan begot Sidon, his firstborn, and Heth;
the Jebusite, the Amorite, and the Girgashite;
the Hivite, the Arkite, and the Sinite;
the Arvadite, the Zemarite, and the Hamathite.
The sons of (Gen. 10:22-29; 11:10) Shem were Elam, Asshur, (Luke 3:36) Arphaxad, Lud, Aram, Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech.
Arphaxad begot Shelah, and Shelah begot Eber.
To Eber were born two sons: the name of one was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided; and his brother’s name was Joktan.
(Gen. 10:26) Joktan begot Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
Ebal, Abimael, Sheba,
Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.
(Gen. 11:10-26; Luke 3:34-36) Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah,
(Gen. 11:15) Eber, Peleg, Reu,
Serug, Nahor, Terah,
and (Gen. 17:5) Abram, who is Abraham.
(Gen. 21:2, 3) The sons of Abraham were (Gen. 21:2) Isaac and (Gen. 16:11, 15) Ishmael.
The Family of Ishmael These are their genealogies: The (Gen. 25:13-16) firstborn of Ishmael was Nebajoth; then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,
Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These were the sons of Ishmael.
The Family of Keturah Now (Gen. 25:1-4) the sons born to Keturah, Abraham’s concubine, were Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah. The sons of Jokshan were Sheba and Dedan.
The sons of Midian were Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the children of Keturah.
The Family of Isaac And (Gen. 21:2) Abraham begot Isaac. (Gen. 25:9, 25, 26, 29; 32:28) The sons of Isaac were Esau and Israel.
The sons of (Gen. 36:10-19) Esau were Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jaalam, and Korah.
And the sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zephi, Gatam, and Kenaz; and by (Gen. 36:12) Timna, Amalek.
The sons of Reuel were Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.
The Family of Seir (Gen. 36:20-28) The sons of Seir were Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.
And the sons of Lotan were Hori and Homam; Lotan’s sister was Timna.
The sons of Shobal were Alian, Manahath, Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. The sons of Zibeon were Ajah and Anah.
The son of Anah was (Gen. 36:25) Dishon. The sons of Dishon were Hamran, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.
The sons of Ezer were Bilhan, Zaavan, and Jaakan. The sons of Dishan were Uz and Aran.

The Kings of Edom Now these were the (Gen. 36:31-43) kings who reigned in the land of Edom before a king reigned over the children of Israel: Bela the son of Beor, and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
And when Bela died, Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his place.
When Jobab died, Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his place.
